questions.text: True about Effect of estrogen and progesterone on Uterus: Estrogen aids estrogen in myometrial hypertrophy Progesterone increase in the tortuosity of glands, ↑ lipid, and glycogen deposits Estrogen stimulates the synthesis of myometrial contractile protein actinomycin through cAMP Progesterone dominated uterus is also more sensitive to oxytocin
questions.explanation:
Effect of estrogen Effect of progesterone
  • Estrogen causes marked proliferation of the endometrial stroma and greatly increased development of the endometrial glands
  • Estrogen causes hypertrophy of the myometrium.
  • Estrogen stimulates the synthesis of myometrial contractile protein actinomycin through cAMP. Under the influence of estrogens, the muscles become more active and excitable and action potentials in the individual fibers become more frequent.
  • The estrogen dominated uterus is also more sensitive to oxytocin
  • Promote secretory changes in the uterine endometrium during the latter half of the monthly female sexual cycle, thus prepares the uterus for implantation of the fertilized ovum.
  • It aids estrogen in myometrial hypertrophy
  • Increase in the tortuosity of glands
  • ↑ lipid and glycogen deposits
  • Decreases the frequency and intensity of uterine contractions, thereby helping to prevent expulsion of the implanted ovum but increases the amplitude of contraction.

III Involvement of stomach and LN on both sided of diaphragm
IV Haematogenous spread (stomach and one or more extra-lymphatic organs or tissues)

questions.text: A 40 years old American female on her visit to India developed Right lower quadrant pain in the abdomen. The patient was diagnosed as acute appendicitis and planned for laparoscopic appendectomy. In the surgery, the patient suddenly developed signs of acidosis & renal failure associated with myoglobinuria. Which of the following would be not seen in this patient?

A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency room after sustaining burns during a fire in his apartment. He has blistering and erythema of his face, left upper extremity, and chest with frank charring of his right upper extremity. He is agitated, hypotensive, and tachycardiac. Which one of the following statements concerning this patient’s initial wound management is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Topical antibiotics should not be used, as they will encourage growth of resistant organisms

options.label: B
options.text: Early excision of facial and hand burns is especially important

options.label: C
options.text: Escharotomy should only be performed if neurologic impairment is imminent

options.label: D
options.text: Excision of areas of third-degree or of deep second-degree burns usually takes place 3–7 days after injury

questions.correct_answer: D. Excision of areas of third-degree or of deep second-degree burns usually takes place 3–7 days after injury

A 19-year-old boy brought to the hospital with alleged history of road traffic accident sustained severe head injury and lost consciousness. A 70-year-old woman complains of a dull pain in her lower back, especially when bending forwards to lift things. She presents after a severe episode in the last 2 days. For this condition, Which of the following is not a recognized as a cause?

In humans, the blastocyst burrows in the uterine cavity till the whole of it lies within the thickness of the endometrium. This is called interstitial implantation. This occurs on what day, following fertilization?
questions.explanation:
Important Events Following Fertilization
‘0’ hour Fertilization
4 day 16 cell stageMorula enters uterine cavity
5th day Blastocyst
7th day Interstitial implantation occurs
21st – 22nd day Placenta fully established/Fetal circulation established and heart-formed
8 weeks Internal gonads formed
10–12 weeks Swallowing starts
11 weeks Fetal breathing movements
12 weeks External genitalia formed Urine formation occurs
14 weeks Gender can be identified on USG

questions.text: A mentally unstable pregnant woman was brought to the hospital from the roadside by social workers. No medical or surgical history of the patient was able to be collected. Since the patient was mentally ill her Last LMP was not recorded. So the patient was sent to the radiology department for estimation of fetal age through ultrasound. If the patient was in her 3rd trimester, the best parameter for estimation of fetal age by ultrasound would be:
questions.explanation:
1st trimester Crown Rump length (CRL)
2nd trimester Biparietal diameter (BPD)
3rd trimester Femur length
Overall Crown Rump length (CRL)

questions.text: A 52-year-old man complains of a 3-week history of malaise and shortness of breath. He has lost weight in the last few months but attributes this to a loss of appetite possibly due to stress at work. On examination, he has a palpable mass in the right lumbar region. He has no urinary symptoms. However, the urine dipstick detected blood. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 52-year-old man presents to accident and emergency after collapsing at home. He appears pale on appearance with cold extremities. Blood pressure is 97/73 mmHg, heart rate 110 bpm, temperature 36.9°C, and an ECG shows normal findings. Blood culture and urine culture are negative for any findings. He reports returning from a weekend break in Wales but forgot to take his medication for Crohn’s disease with him. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 55-year-old man presents to the medicine outpatient department with his wife with a 4-week history of progressively worsening right shoulder pain radiating down his right arm and into his upper back. He has also reported blurred vision in his right eye and felt his right eyelid was 'drooping'. His only other history, of note, is being an ex-smoker with a 25-pack-year history. He also reported that he had recently been to the gym and noticed only the left side of his face was sweating. Examination reveals partial ptosis of the right eye , a constricted right pupil, and reduced sensation in the right T1 dermatome . A chest radiograph is performed and shows the following finding (image). What will be the most probable diagnosis ?

A 66-year-old woman presents to accident and emergency with a 2-day history of shortness of breath. The patient notes becoming progressively short of breath as well as a sharp pain in the right side of the chest which is most painful when taking a deep breath. The patient also complains of mild pain in the right leg, though there is nothing significant on full cardiovascular and respiratory examination . Heart rate is 96 and respiratory rate is 12. The patient denies any weight loss or long haul flights but mentions undergoing a nasal polypectomy 3 weeks ago. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Measurement score
≥65 years 1
Previous DVT or PE 3
Surgery or fracture ≤ 4 weeks 2
Malignancy 2
unilateral leg pain 3
Unilateral oedema 4
Haemoptysis 2
Heart rate: 75-94 3
Heart rate: >95 5

questions.text: A 32-year-old G4P3L0 was admitted to the hospital at 11 weeks gestation as a case of sextuplets pregnancy diagnosed by ultrasound. She had been married for six years with three previous term intrauterine fetal deaths (2 male & 1 female) expelled vaginally in hospital. In a case of multifetal pregnancies like this patient, the fetal reduction is done to minimize complications by:

A 34-year-old man who was diving to 90 feet of water experienced difficulty clearing his ears during descent. . Also, during the dive he noticed a different quality to his hearing. This sensation continued when he surfaced. He denied vertigo, dizziness, and disequilibrium at the time, but he did note a sensation of fullness in the left ear, with intermittent, high-pitched tinnitus. The patient came to the ENT clinic within hours of this event. Examination revealed a retracted tympanic membrane on the left without an air-fluid level. The tympanic membrane was hypervascular. The remainder of the physical examination was unremarkable. Management plan for this patient would be:

options.label: B
options.text: Middle ear ventilation should be restored by decongestants, catheterization, or myringotomy

options.label: C
options.text: Surgery of choice - Posterior semicircular canal occlusion

options.label: D
options.text: Oral acyclovir to be started within 72 hours of the onset of tinnitus

questions.correct_answer: B. Middle ear ventilation should be restored by decongestants, catheterization, or myringotomy

questions.text: A pediatric patient came to your hospital with complaints of short stature. No other significant complaints were present in this patient. On examination, the patient’s bone age is similar to that of chronological age. Which of the following is responsible for the short stature?

A patient arrived at the emergency department sustaining an injury to the elbow after falling from the tree. Your orthopedician diagnosed it as terrible triad of elbow. Which of the following is correct about the terrible triad of the elbow?

options.label: A
options.text: Humerus fracture with lateral and medial epicondyle fracture

options.label: B
options.text: Humerus shaft fracture with dislocation and ulnar fracture

options.label: C
options.text: Elbow dislocation with Ulnar and Coronoid fractureElbow dislocation with radial head and coronoid fracture

questions.text: A 64-year-old man presents with headache and left-sided upper extremity weakness. The MRI findings suggest that this is a glioblastoma multiforme. This is because the tumor exhibits which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: It is well demarcated from surrounding brain tissue.

options.label: C
options.text: It shows a ring pattern of enhancement with intravenous contrast and has a nonenhancing necrotic center.

options.label: D
options.text: It shows an absence of surrounding white-matter edema.

questions.correct_answer: C. It shows a ring pattern of enhancement with intravenous contrast and has a nonenhancing necrotic center.

All of the following are advantages of vaginal hysterectomy over abdominal hysterectomy except: Better tolerated by elderly and obese patients Lesser risk of postoperative thromboembolism Other visceral structures can be easily visualized Corrects prolapse of other organs
questions.explanation:
Advantages Disadvantages
  • Can be done in obese patients
  • Less postoperative complications
  • Less morbidity and mortality
  • Less postoperative pain
  • Less hospital stay
  • No abdominal scar
  • Early resumption of day to day activities
  • Exploration of abdominal organs and pelvic organs cannot be done
  • Tubo-ovarian pathologies cannot be simultaneously dealt
  • Difficult to perform if the uterus is >12 weeks size and if pelvic adhesions are present
  • Concurrent surgical procedures cannot be done

Treatment Underlying cause

questions.text: A 17-year old girl complained of sore throat, cervical lymphadenopathy, and halitosis. The patient had no fever. The oral cavity, nose, nasopharynx, and larynx were clear but had a gray pseudo-membrane and ulcer without bleeding on her tonsils. A 20 years old male presents with chronic constipation, headache and Marfanoid habitus, neuromas of the tongue, medullated corneal nerve fibers, and nodule of 2x2 cm size in the left lobe of thyroid. The most probable diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
MEN2A(Sipple’s syndrome) MEN2B (also known as MEN3)
Features of Medullary thyroid carcinoma Multifocal , Bilateral Multifocal , Bilateral , Occurs earlier even within the first year of life
Inheritance pattern Autosomal dominant Autosomal dominant
Associated abnormalities Phaeochromocytomas, hyperparathyroidism, lichen planus amyloidosis Phaeochromocytomas, multiple mucosal neuromas, mega colon, skeletal abnormalities (craniosynostosis), Marfanoid habits, abnormal dental enamel

questions.text: A 55-year-old man has presented to his GP complaining of several episodes of spontaneous facial blushing. In addition, he mentions he has had several episodes of watery diarrhoea. There is a grade 2/6 pansystolic murmur at the apex. Chest examination reveals bibasilar inspiratory crackles. In addition to digoxin and furosemide, which of the following medications would be MOST appropriate?
